content.text:
# 1964 in the Democratic Republic of the Congo

The following lists events that happened during 1964 in the Republic of Congo.
Incumbents
* President: Joseph Kasa-Vubu
* Prime Minister: Cyrille Adoula – Moïse Tshombe
Events
{|class=wikitable
!style="width:8em" |Date !!Event
|-
| 25 June -10 July
| Constitutional referendum approves the Constitution de Luluabourg.
|-
| 10 July
| Moïse Tshombe takes office as interim prime minister
|-
|
| Tshombe government announces parliamentary elections will be held by 30 March 1965.
|}
References
Sources
*
|title=DRC: Background to the 1965 election |publisher=Electoral Institute for Sustainable Democracy in Africa}}
